member.name: D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION
member.summary: Defines constants that specify what should be done with the results of earlier workload instrumentation.

member.name: D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION.D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION_KEEP_ALL
member.summary: The default setting. Specifies that all results should be kept.

member.name: D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION.D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION_COMMIT_RESULTS
member.summary: Specifies that the driver has seen all the data that it's ever going to, so it should stop waiting for more and go ahead compiling optimized shaders.

member.name: D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION.D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION_COMMIT_RESULTS_HIGH_PRIORITY
member.summary: Like D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION_COMMIT_RESULTS, but also specifies that your application doesn't care about glitches, so the runtime should ignore the usual idle priority rules and go ahead using as many threads as possible to get shader recompiles done fast. Available only in Developer mode.

member.name: D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION.D3D12_MEASUREMENTS_ACTION_DISCARD_PREVIOUS
member.summary: Specifies that the optimization state should be reset; hinting that whatever has previously been measured no longer applies.
